intro: Liparis macrotis, commonly known as the large-leaf orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has strap-shaped leaves and produces numerous small, greenish-white flowers clustered in a raceme. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Liparis macrotis is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
